It is native to the high elevations of the western United States, particularly in California and Nevada. This evergreen conifer has needle-like leaves that are typically light green with a subtle blue tint. Its cones are cylindrical and have a distinctive shape, often maturing to a reddish-brown color. The plant is characterized by its slow growth rate and is adapted to cold, moist environments with well-drained soils.

Due to its limited range, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its habitat.
